text: Hi there, are there any breaking changes for Observables? ( got a PR to update it to 0.4)? It really doesn't look like it from the releases tab, but I just wanted to make sure with the experts: <https://github.com/JuliaGizmos/Observables.jl/releases/tag/v0.4.0>

elements.text: Hi there, are there any breaking changes for Observables? ( got a PR to update it to 0.4)? It really doesn't look like it from the releases tab, but I just wanted to make sure with the experts:

text: not really, `on(f, ...)` returns `ObserverFunction`s now, which you can call `off` on and that's nice to detach things, but you will probably not have stored the result from `on` before

text: The biggest breaking change is `connect!` which reversed the order of its arguments to match the docstring and Julia's conventions. But `map` and `map!` also behave differently.
